sub_title: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
summary: As specialist advisor at the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate, I have transferred to the new team of Transition Deep Subsurface in the cluster of Mining Policy. Transition Deep Subsurface will focus more on the energy transition, which will have to take place in the surface as well as the subsurface. I will focus on the role of salt in the subsurface, concerning both salt production as well as energy storage in old salt caverns, both now and in the future. As such I coördinate salt research, issues arising concerning the salt industry (subsurface), reply to government questions, and formulatie policy using my experience and knowledge about the deep subsurface.

awards.title: Excellent Researcher 2015
awards.description: The award for excellent young researcher of TNO is an award for a young researcher of TNO with a lot of potential who has made significant achievements in his/her research field.

awards.title: Impactprijs Energie 2014
awards.description: Winner of the "Impact Prijs Energie" which is an internal TNO price for the project with the most impact in the Energy sector. My project was "Induced seismicity of the Groningen field; contributions to the steering committee, the subsurface committee and the research of TNO".

projects.title: Induced seismicity of the Groningen gas field: from compaction to risk
projects.description:
Ongoing project on the induced seismicity of the Groningen gas field.

Reports submitted in 2015 and 2016:
http://www.nlog.nl/en/groningen-gasfield-0

contributors.headline: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

projects.title: Recent developments on the seismicity of the Groningen field in 2015
projects.description:
In the beginning of 2015, the Minister of Economic Affairs decided to impose production caps to the Groningen gas production on a semi-yearly basis. For the first six months of 2015 a maximum gas production of 16,5 bcm was allowed. In January 2015 State Supervision of Mines (SSM) advised to reduce production to 39,4 bcm in 2015 and 2016. After a new advice from SSM, which is expected to be presented in June 2015, the definitive production maximum for 2015 will be defined.
In support of their advice of June 1st 2015, State Supervision of Mines has requested the following additional technical evaluations from TNO-AGE:
 An update on the seismicity of the Groningen field
 compaction field based on inversion of subsidence data

contributors.headline: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

projects.title: Recent developments on the induced seismicity of the Groningen field  - focus on the soutwestern area
projects.description: This project was a follow-up on the previous project on the Groningen seismicity with a focus on the southwestern area of the field. My responsibilities included the project management, the reporting, and a review on the work done by NAM on the same area.

contributors.headline: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
Expert on Subsurface, Sustainability and Energy Transition: Energy Storage | Hydrogen | Geothermal | CCS | coordinating international research | #TNOenergytransition

projects.title: Induced seismicity of the Groningen field - extra scenario calculations
projects.description: In this projects questions regarding the induced seismciity of the Groningen field were answered. The questions encompassed different production scenario's and strategies and the difference between pressure gradients and compaction gradients. My responsibilities included the calculations, the reporting and the project mangement.

contributors.headline: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

projects.title: Induced Seismicity of the Groningen field -2013
projects.description: My responsibility last year was the Groningen induced seismicity project. The project aimed at a better understanding of the induced seismicity of the Groningen field as a preparation for the advice to the production plan which was planned in december 2013 and the decision by the Minister of Economic Affairs in january 2014. This project consisted of control calculations of the subsidence and compaction of the field, own geomechanical work and answers to questions from the State Supervision of Mines. Together with 11 team members we have written the report indicated in the URL.

contributors.headline: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur bij Transitie Diepe Ondergrond - Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

projects.title: GEISER
projects.description: GEISER (Geothermal Engineering Integrating Mitigation of Induced Seismicity in Reservoirs) is a European research program which involves multiple European companies/research institutes (ETHZ,  GFZ, TNO, BRGM, ISOR, Statoil, GeoWatt, NORSAR, Armines, EOST, KNMI, AMRA, INGV). In this program all aspects of induced seismicity during Enhanced Geothermal System (EGS) operations are covered. In EGS, cold water is injected (under high pressure) into the rock increasing the permeability of the rock through hydraulic fracturing. The water travels through fractures to another well while being heated up by the surroundings. This hot water is pumped up and converted into electricity. In EGS, interest in induced seismicity is two-fold. Induced seismicity gives insight in fluid pathways induced by hydraulic fracturing but may also represent an unwanted side effect.

profile_positions.description: As specialist advisor at the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate, I have transferred to the new team of Transition Deep Subsurface in the cluster of Mining Policy. Transition Deep Subsurface will focus more on the energy transition, which will have to take place in the surface as well as the subsurface. I will focus on the role of salt in the subsurface, concerning both salt production as well as energy storage in old salt caverns, both now and in the future. As such I coördinate salt research, issues arising concerning the salt industry (subsurface), reply to government questions, and formulate policy.
profile_positions.title: Senior Coördinating Specialist Advisor - Transition deep subsurface

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
In de projectdirectie Gastransitie Groningen houd ik me bezig met de adviestrajecten en besluiten voor de afname van de gasproductie uit het Groningen gasveld.

Daarnaast coördineer ik het KEM (Kennis Effecten Mijnbouw) programma op het Ministerie.
profile_positions.title: Senior Coördinerend Specialistisch Adviseur

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description: For the Knowledge program effects of mining (KEM, see also KEMprogramma.nl) I coördinate the research of the KEM program at the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate.
profile_positions.title: Coördinator Knowledge program Effects of Mining at the Minstry of Economic Affairs and Climate

profile_positions.description:
The Advisory Group for Economic Affairs is a division within TNO that supports the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs with technical expertise on mining. I am responsible for supervising reserach projects and technical expert advisory on all geomechanics related issues (e.g. subsidence, induced seismicity, salt geomechanics).

Topics:
- Subsidence due to gas depletion of the Groningen gas field
- Induced seismicity due to gas depletion of the Groningen gas field
- Subsidence of the Waddensea area due to gas depletion
- Subsidence due to salt mining in the Veendam area
- Subsidence due to salt mining in the Barradeel area
- Well abandonment in the Barradeel area
- Induced seismicity of the Roswinkel field
- Induced seismicity of the Bergermeer field
- induced seismicity of the small gas fields in the Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Geomechanics at the Advisory Group for Economic Affairs

profile_positions.description:

- Determine seismic hazard prior to production EGS

- 2U-CC storage
